mods.abstract: STOP THE THIEF! $500 Reward! WILL be paid for the apprehension and conviction of the person or persons who, it is believed, has conducted away from my plantation on Monday night, the 4th of the present month, the following described slaves, who were recently purchased in New Orleans, from Mr. George Davis and Mr. Walter L. Campbell, traders : -- George Granger, light black color, about 27 years of age, 5 feet 9 to 10 inches high. Manson, black, 28 years old, 5 feet 8 to 9 inches high. Bob, his brother, black, stout built, 26 years old, 5 feet 8 to 9 inches high. George, a nephew to Manson and Bob, black, 18 years old, about 5 feet 4 to 5 inches high. Charles Nichols, copper colored, 22 years old, nearly six feet high, slender, with a finger of the left hand burnt. Alsinda, a woman, 20 years old, black, stout, has a front tooth out, 5 feet 2 to 3 inches high. Mary Ann, black, 18 years old, slender, 5 feet 2 to 3 inches high. The men had a suit of blue cloth clothes and a suit of Lowell shirting and twilled cotton pantaloons. The women had on calico dresses. Two hundred dollars will be paid by the undersigned for the recovery of the above negroes, and all necessary expenses paid, and if they should be taken separately, a proportionate reward will be paid. S. W. WIKOFF. Bellevue, St-Landry, June 16th, 1855--tf
